results.title: Peter Ustinov's Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Presents Peter Ustinov’s personal view of Leningrad. He briefly relates the city’s history, showing many of the buildings - St. Peter and St. Paul Cathedral, the Imperial Winter Palace, St. Isaac’s Cathedral, amongst many others. He discusses many aspects of the arts, literature, music ballet and drama of Leningrad.

results.title: Peter Sculthorpe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: on music”.
Peter Sculthorpe, Australia’s best-known contemporary composer, discusses his personal philosophy and the influences which have shaped his creative development. Sculthorpe studied at the Melbourne University Conservatorium of Music and at Oxford University. His “Sonatina for Piano” was performed at the International Society of Contemporary Music Festival in Baden-Baden in 1955 and he went on to receive international recognition with the success of his Sun Music series. Throughout his career, Sculthorpe has drawn on a diversity of cultural influences in his quest to develop uniquely Australian music. He has composed for film, television, theatre and opera as well as the concert platform, and enjoys the status of elder statesman among contemporary Australian composers. A performance of his work “Kakadu” in 1989 was a rallying point for Australian conservationists and since then Sculthorpe has used his music to promote environmental causes. Research and interview: James Murdoch.

results.title: Peter Principle: jumping for jelly beans, etc.
results.brief_description: Peter Principle. Dr. Peter offers his disturbing insight into why people get promoted to their level of competence. Why people struggle up the hierarchy of an organization when it is no good for neither them or the company? “Jumping Jelly Beans” Professor Fred Hezberges name is associated with the study of motivation. Here he delivers his theories in a stimulating lecture. “Up the organization”. Robert Townsend expounds his radical philosophy on the subject of running a business. No department is safe from his challenging and witty criticism.

results.title: Peter Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
From his book-crammed London flat, Peter Porter introduces a variety of his best-known poems and presents his accessible and humane intelligence.

results.title: Peter Pan (Disney) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Pictures, Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimi and Wilfred Jackson
results.brief_description: Disney’s well-loved version of the Sir James M. Barrie play. The Darling children are taken on a series of wonderful adventures to Never-never Land. Their guide is the daring and magical Peter Pan who refuses to ever grow up. Along with Peter and his gang of Lost Boys, assisted by the beautiful fairy Tinkerbell, the Darling children do battle against the wicked Captain Hook to save Never-never Land from his evil plans. Beautifully animated and featuring the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Kathryn Beaumont.

results.title: Peter Pan
results.brief_description: Wendy Darling awakes one night to discover Peter Pan searching for his shadow. She helps him to find it, sews it back on and in return Peter and fairy, Tinker Bell teach the children to fly.

results.title: Peter Pan
results.creator_credit: Richard Halliday, National Broadcasting Company and Vincent J. Donehue
results.brief_description: Based on the Broadway musical production of James Barrie’s classic children’s story, this made for television version of ‘Peter Pan’ stars Mary Martin, who also played the lead role in the stage play. Forty-seven years old at the time, Martin is nevertheless convincing as Peter Pan, the little boy that won’t grow up who whisks the Darling children out of their London nursery and off to Never Never Land. Song highlights include: “I’ve Gotta Crow,” “I’m Flying,” “I Won’t Grow Up,” “Neverland,” Ugg-a-Wugg” and “Hook’s Waltz.
